title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted - Hindustan Times
summary:
Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted

Date: January 4, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Flight and train operations have been severely impacted in Delhi due to dense fog, leading to flight diversions and delays.

  • Normal operations have resumed at Delhi airport after interruptions.
  • A total of 19 flights were diverted due to adverse weather conditions early Saturday.
  • IndiGo and Air India reported temporary halts in operations due to extremely low visibility.
  • 81 trains were delayed at New Delhi station also owing to the fog.
  • Cold wave conditions affected several regions, including Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan.
“Due to adverse weather conditions in Delhi, 19 flight diversions were reported between 0015 hours and 0130 hours. Operations have now returned to normal.” - Delhi International Airport Limited

The recovery of operations signifies a return to normalcy at Delhi airport, but the impact of the weather has disrupted travel significantly.
newTitle: Weather news live: Normal operations resume at Delhi airport; 19 flights diverted

title: 'Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy': PM Modi - News18
summary:
Govt's Intentions, Policies, Decisions Filling Rural India With New Energy

Date: January 04, 2025   Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi emphasized that the Indian government's initiatives are energizing rural India, aiming to empower communities and transform villages into hubs of growth.

  • PM Modi spoke at the Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025, celebrating rural India's resilience.
  • He highlighted increasing accessibility to healthcare services in rural areas.
  • An approximate Rs. 3 lakh crore in financial assistance has been provided to farmers under the PM-KISAN scheme.
“During the COVID pandemic, the world doubted how Indian villages would tackle the crisis, but we ensured vaccines reached the last person in every village.” – PM Modi

BJP's First List For Delhi Polls In, Parvesh Verma To Contest Arvind Kejriwal - NDTV
summary:
BJP Announces Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections, Parvesh Verma to Challenge Kejriwal

Publication Date: January 4, 2025

Source: NDTV

The BJP has unveiled its first list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections, targeting 29 out of the 70 seats available. Former BJP MP Parvesh Verma is set to contest against AAP's Arvind Kejriwal in New Delhi.

  • The elections are scheduled for February 2025.
  • Parvesh Verma expresses gratitude to the BJP leadership for their trust in him.
  • Other notable candidates include Kailash Gehlot, Ramesh Bidhuri, and Arvinder Singh Lovely, who have shifted parties.
  • The upcoming elections are anticipated to be a tightly contested battle between the BJP and AAP.
  • The Congress party has not won any Delhi seats in the last two Assembly elections.
“Delhi is suffering because of Arvind Kejriwal. The people of Kalkaji have also faced 'AAPda' under Chief Minister Atishi,” said Ramesh Bidhuri, expressing his commitment to reclaiming his seat.

The rivalry between BJP and AAP is heating up as former allies in the Opposition bloc, Congress and AAP, prepare to face off in the elections.
newTitle: BJP Announces Candidates for Delhi Assembly Elections, Parvesh Verma to Challenge Kejriwal

title: Why is Garmin banned in India? Athletes tracking sports activity with these popular devices may land in jail | Today News - Mint
summary:
Why is Garmin banned in India? Athletes tracking sports activity with these popular devices may land in jail

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

Garmin devices are not entirely banned in India, but certain models that feature satellite communication can lead to legal trouble for users. Recent incidents involving foreigners have highlighted the risks associated with these gadgets.

Key Points:

  • Garmin devices using satellite communication, such as the Garmin inReach, are illegal in India without permission.
  • A Scottish hiker was detained at Delhi Airport for carrying a Garmin inReach.
  • Another foreign national faced similar issues with a Garmin Edge 540 GPS device.
  • The Indian Wireless Telegraphy Act of 1933 makes the use of such devices without licensing illegal.
  • Travelers are warned not to bring satellite phones or devices to India without prior approval.
“The Garmin was illegal here and that they were handing me over to the Police.” - Scottish hiker

This highlights the importance for travelers to understand local regulations regarding technology and devices. The consequences of ignoring these laws can lead to serious legal action.
newTitle: Garmin Devices and Legal Issues in India

title: Arvind Kejriwal's 'Congress-BJP' Allies Charge Amid Protest By Punjab Women - NDTV
summary:
Kejriwal Accuses Congress and BJP of Collusion Amid Protests

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Amid protests led by women from Punjab outside his residence, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal launched a scathing attack on the Congress and BJP, accusing them of working in alliance to oppose his party.

  • Kejriwal stated that the protesting women are affiliates of Congress and BJP, not supporters from Punjab.
  • He claimed that AAP's governance model reliably delivers on its promises, citing free water supply to over 12 lakh families in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal announced a halt to payments for erroneous water bills, promising correction after upcoming elections.
  • Women from Punjab accused AAP of failing to deliver on the Rs 1,000 monthly stipend commitment.
  • Congress criticized AAP, claiming it would mislead women in Delhi just as it did in Punjab.
  • The controversy surrounding AAP's Mahila Samman Yojana intensified due to allegations of unauthorized data collection.
  • BJP announced its first list of candidates for the 2025 Delhi assembly elections.
“Is he scared? The people of Delhi aren't fools. The people will give him an answer in the elections.” - Congress leader Pawan Khera

This situation reflects ongoing political tensions in Delhi, especially as the assembly elections approach, highlighting the competition between AAP, Congress, and BJP.
newTitle: Kejriwal Accuses Congress and BJP of Collusion Amid Protests

title: Children on social media, breach notifications and more: The draft Data Protection Rules 2025 - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Children on social media, breach notifications and more: The draft Data Protection Rules 2025

Published on: 04 Jan 2025, 7:34 am

The draft Digital Personal Data Protection Rules, 2025, aim to protect children's personal data by requiring parental consent before processing. The government seeks feedback on the rules by February 18, 2025.

  • Social media platforms must obtain verifiable parental consent for processing children's data.
  • Data fiduciaries must confirm the guardian's identity before processing a child's data.
  • State entities can process personal data for providing subsidies and services, under certain conditions.
  • Data fiduciaries must implement reasonable security safeguards to protect personal data.
  • In case of data breaches, timely notification of affected individuals is required, including details on the breach and mitigation measures.
  • Personal data must be erased if not used for its intended purpose, promoting responsible data retention practices.
“C is a child, P is her parent, and DF is a Data Fiduciary. A user account of C is sought to be created on the online platform of DF, by processing the personal data of C.”

The implementation of these rules could significantly enhance the protection of children's data in the digital space while ensuring accountability among data fiduciaries.
newTitle: Draft Data Protection Rules 2025 Introduce Child Safety Measures on Social Media

US NSA Sullivan to push for Middle-East economic corridor in talks with Ajit Doval - Hindustan Times
summary:
US NSA Sullivan to Push for Middle-East Economic Corridor in Talks with Ajit Doval

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Outgoing US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan will discuss operationalizing the Middle-East Economic Corridor with Indian NSA Ajit Doval, focusing on technology transfer and strategic ties between the US and India.

  • Sullivan's upcoming meeting marks the third round of the Critical and Emerging Technologies dialogue with India.
  • The Middle-East Economic Corridor discussions come amid tensions from the Gaza conflict.
  • Sullivan has facilitated key technology access and defense agreements between the US and India.
  • His tenure included efforts to address cross-border terrorism issues concerning Pakistan.
  • The meeting signifies India's readiness to maintain strong ties with the US amid changing administrations.
“Sullivan, despite his young age, played a key part in putting pressure on Pakistan on cross-border terrorism against India.”

The talks aim to bolster India-US relations and establish a feasible economic corridor amidst geopolitical challenges.
newTitle: US NSA Sullivan to Push for Middle-East Economic Corridor in Talks with Ajit Doval

title: Tamil Nadu: 6 workers killed in explosion at Virudhunagar fireworks unit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Explosion at Tamil Nadu Fireworks Unit Claims Lives of 6 Workers

Date: Jan 04, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

At least six workers were killed after an explosion occurred at a firecracker manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Virudhunagar. The blast is suspected to have taken place during the process of mixing chemicals.

  • Explosion at a fireworks manufacturing unit in Virudhunagar, Tamil Nadu.
  • At least six workers confirmed dead.
  • The explosion occurred while mixing chemicals, flattening at least one room.
  • Fire and rescue department has reached the location.
No injuries were reported in a separate incident involving an LPG tanker that overturned in Coimbatore.

This tragic incident highlights the ongoing safety concerns related to hazardous materials in manufacturing settings.
newTitle: Explosion at Tamil Nadu Fireworks Unit Claims Lives of 6 Workers

Gas tragedy waste disposal: Police register five cases against protesters opposing incineration - The Hindu
summary:
Gas tragedy waste disposal: Police register five cases against protesters opposing incineration

Date: January 04, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Madhya Pradesh police have filed five cases against protesters who opposed the disposal of toxic waste linked to the Bhopal gas tragedy, leading to significant unrest in Pithampur.

  • Protests erupted after 337 tonnes of toxic waste reached the Ramky Enviro company.
  • The police enforced prohibitory orders banning public gatherings around Ramky Enviro.
  • Five separate cases were registered for public disorder.
  • Two individuals attempted self-immolation during the protests but were saved safely.
  • The Chief Minister assured public safety and adherence to judicial directives regarding waste disposal.
“The state government only transported the Union Carbide waste with safety parameters in compliance with the Supreme Court's instructions.” - Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

The situation has returned to normal, with all industrial operations functioning after the protests subsided. Authorities are awaiting further court orders regarding the disposal of the waste.
newTitle: Police File Cases Against Protesters Over Toxic Waste Disposal in Madhya Pradesh

Former Infosys CEO Vishal Sikka recently met Prime Minister Narendra Modi for a ‘wide-ranging discussion’ on artificial intelligence. Sikka expressed feeling ‘inspired and humbled’ by the Prime Minister's understanding of technology.

  • The discussion focused on AI's impact on India and future imperatives.

“It was a privilege to meet the Hon. Prime Minister Sh. @narendramodi for a detailed and wide-ranging discussion on AI, its impact on India and several imperatives for the time ahead. I left the meeting both inspired and humbled by his extraordinary grasp of technology's impact on all of us...”

title: Two including mastermind arrested from Pune in sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh's murder case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Two Arrested in Connection with Sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh's Murder in Pune

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The police in Beed have made two arrests regarding the murder of Santosh Deshmukh, a sarpanch who was killed for allegedly attempting to stop an extortion attempt on a wind energy project.

  • Arrests made of Sudarshan Chandrabhan Ghule and Sudhir Dnyanoba Sangale in Pune.
  • Deshmukh was killed for intervening in an extortion bid against Avaada Energy.
  • The accused have been transferred to the Criminal Investigation Department for further questioning.
  • Previous arrests related to the case include Valmik Karad, who is accused of demanding ₹2 crore.
  • Investigation led to the suspects being tracked down based on critical information obtained during interrogations.
“During interrogation, we obtained critical information about the whereabouts of the accused from Dr Sambhaji Waybhase, who is also being questioned,” police said.

The investigation continues as police seek to uncover further details about the murder and the extortion scheme it aimed to thwart.
newTitle: Two Arrested in Connection with Sarpanch Santosh Deshmukh's Murder in Pune

title: 500 On Bumble, 200 On Snapchat: Delhi Man Scams 700 Women As "US Model" - NDTV
summary:
Delhi Man Scams Over 700 Women by Posing as US Model on Dating Apps

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

An East Delhi man was arrested for defrauding over 700 women by posing as a US-based model on dating apps, using manipulation and blackmail for financial gain.

Key Points:

  • Tushar Singh Bisht, 23, worked as a recruiter in Noida while engaging in cybercrime at night.
  • Created fake profiles on dating apps using stolen photos of a Brazilian model.
  • Targeted primarily women aged 18-30, extorting money with manipulated intimate content.
  • Victims were threatened with the release of personal content if they refused to pay.
  • Police investigations revealed over 500 women contacted on Bumble and more than 200 on Snapchat.
  • Recovered mobile phone and incriminating evidence during the arrest.
  • At least four victims have been identified in addition to the initial complainant.
“If a victim refused his demands for money, he would threaten to upload their explicit content online or sell it on the dark web.”

The investigation highlights the growing danger of online impersonation and the need for awareness regarding online interactions and privacy.
newTitle: Delhi Man Scams Over 700 Women by Posing as US Model on Dating Apps

title: ‘We met to eat meals’: Karnataka CM rules out change of guard as minister hosts dinner for him - Hindustan Times
summary:
Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah Rules Out Change in Leadership Amid Dinner Speculations

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has dismissed rumors of changes in the government's leadership following a dinner hosted by Public Works Minister Satish Jarkiholi. The gathering included about 18 to 20 ministers and was characterized as simply a meal, despite speculations of political discussions.

  • Chief Minister Siddaramaiah confirms no plans for a cabinet reshuffle.
  • The dinner was attended by 18-20 ministers and MLAs.
  • Speculation arose regarding a potential change in the Congress state presidency.
  • Opposition claims that internal conflicts within Congress may lead to governmental instability.
“What can I do if you speculate about our gathering over dinner as a meeting?” - Siddaramaiah

title: R Chidambaram, one of the architects of India’s nuclear programme, dies at 88 - The Indian Express
summary:
R Chidambaram, one of the architects of India’s nuclear programme, dies at 88

Publication Date: Saturday morning | Source: Indian Express

Dr R Chidambaram, former head of the Atomic Energy Commission and a key figure in India’s nuclear programme, passed away at the age of 88 after a prolonged illness.

  • Chidambaram played a significant role in India's nuclear tests in 1974 and 1998.
  • He was instrumental in negotiating the civil nuclear agreement with the US, enhancing India's position in the global nuclear community.
  • He received the Padma Shri in 1975 for his contributions to science and technology.
  • Chidambaram served as the Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission from 1993 to 2000.
  • He was appointed as the Principal Scientific Advisor to the Government after his tenure at the Atomic Energy Commission.
“He was a celebrated scientist whose contributions shaped India's nuclear policy.”

Dr R Chidambaram's legacy as a pioneering scientist will continue to influence India's technological and scientific advancements.
newTitle: R Chidambaram, one of the architects of India’s nuclear programme, dies at 88

title: R Chidambaram, one of the architects of India’s nuclear programme, dies at 88; PM Modi shares condolence message - The Indian Express
summary:
R Chidambaram, Architect of India's Nuclear Programme, Dies at 88

Publication Date: Saturday, Source: Various

Dr R Chidambaram, former head of the Atomic Energy Commission and a key figure in India's nuclear development, has passed away at the age of 88. His contributions significantly advanced India's scientific and nuclear capabilities.

  • Chidambaram played a crucial role in India’s nuclear tests in 1974 and 1998.
  • He was instrumental in the civil nuclear agreement with the US.
  • Chidambaram served as director of BARC and chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission.
  • He was the principal scientific advisor after retiring from the Atomic Energy Commission.
  • His work included overseeing major projects in scientific research and technology.
  • Awards included Padma Shri in 1975 and Padma Vibhushan in 1999.
“Deeply saddened by the demise of Dr Rajagopala Chidambaram. He made ground-breaking contributions in strengthening India’s scientific and strategic capabilities.” - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

Dr Chidambaram's passing is a significant loss to India’s scientific community, remembered for his simplicity and immense contributions to various scientific fields.
newTitle: R Chidambaram, Architect of India's Nuclear Programme, Dies at 88

title: Nuclear scientist Dr Rajagopala Chidambaram passes away - Deccan Herald
summary:
Eminent Nuclear Scientist Dr. Rajagopala Chidambaram Passes Away

Published: 04 January 2025, 03:48 IST

Dr. R. Chidambaram, an influential nuclear scientist known for his roles in India's Pokhran nuclear tests, has passed away after an illness.

  • Dr. Chidambaram was the Director of the Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC).
  • He served as Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission and Secretary of the Department of Atomic Energy.
  • He was the chairman of the board of Governors of the International Atomic Energy Agency during 1994–95.
  • He played a crucial role in India's nuclear weapons program, coordinating preparations for the Pokhran-I and Pokhran-II tests.
  • Dr. Chidambaram was also a proponent of peaceful nuclear energy use, promoting India's nuclear power program.
  • He received several prestigious awards, including Padma Shri and Padma Vibhushan.
newTitle: Eminent Nuclear Scientist Dr. Rajagopala Chidambaram Passes Away

title: Bengaluru to experience severe cold wave, temperatures expected to drop to 10.2°C: IMD - Hindustan Times
summary:
Bengaluru Braces for Severe Cold Wave with Temperatures Dropping to 10.2°C

Date: Jan 04, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that Bengaluru will experience a significant drop in temperatures, potentially reaching a low of 10.2°C on Saturday. This cold wave sweeping across North India is expected to impact weather patterns in the city.

  • IMD forecasts temperatures to dip below the average January temperature of 15.8°C.
  • A warning has been issued about dense fog affecting visibility for commuters.
  • Bengaluru's lowest-ever recorded temperature is 7.8°C, occurring on January 13, 1884.
  • The coldest January temperatures in recent years were recorded at 12°C in 2012 and 12.3°C in 2019.
  • The recent drop could be the most significant since December 2011, when temperatures reached 12.8°C.
The last major temperature dip in December occurred on December 24, 2011, when the temperature dropped to 12.8°C in Bengaluru.

This cold wave is expected to continue affecting the interior regions of Karnataka over the next few days, although coastal areas may not experience significant temperature changes.
newTitle: Bengaluru Braces for Severe Cold Wave with Temperatures Dropping to 10.2°C

title: Who was Mukesh Chandrakar? Body of Bastar journalist, who covered road project corruption, found inside septic tank - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who was Mukesh Chandrakar?

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The body of 28-year-old journalist Mukesh Chandrakar was found in a septic tank on a contractor's property in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur after being reported missing. A murder investigation has been launched.

  • Mukesh played a crucial role in securing the release of CRPF personnel abducted by Maoists in 2021.
  • He had extensive experience, working as a stringer and managing a YouTube channel with over 159,000 subscribers.
  • His recent report on road project corruption may have led to threats against him.
  • Local authorities have launched a murder investigation with several suspects apprehended.
“The news of the murder of Bijapur's young and dedicated journalist Mukesh Chandrakar ji is very sad and heartbreaking.” - Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

His death has raised concerns about the safety of journalists in Chhattisgarh, as they face threats in pursuit of accountability and transparency.
newTitle: Tragic Death of Journalist Mukesh Chandrakar Sparks Outrage

title: Who will pay for your tax cuts? - CNBCTV18
summary:
Who will pay for your tax cuts?

Publication Date: December 3, 2024 Source: CNBC-TV18

India’s growth slump is squeezing its budget at a time when everyone wants a tax cut. At this stage, it’s not clear where the extra money will come from.

  • Government's revenue has slowed considerably, limiting the ability to provide tax breaks.
  • Household debt is on the rise, indicating economic pressure on individuals.
  • Growth in vehicle registrations hit a 46-month low, with rural consumption declining.
  • Finance Minister faces the challenge of balancing tax relief while controlling fiscal deficit.
"The Union Budget, due to be presented next month, must provide income support to India's poor and tax relief for the middle classes," Jairam Ramesh.

The government's ability to manage fiscal policy amid economic pressures poses a complex challenge, impacting future tax and spending decisions.
newTitle: Who will pay for your tax cuts?
